errors.error_description: The instructions omit the `cd sdg-translations` command after cloning the repository, which will cause all subsequent file-path-dependent commands to fail.
correction_candidates: Add the command `cd sdg-translations` after the `git clone` step.
Prefix all subsequent commands with the directory, e.g., `python3 -m venv sdg-translations/venv`.
Clone the repository into the current directory with `git clone https://github.com/open-sdg/sdg-translations.git .`
The `cd` command is not needed if you run the script from the parent directory.
errors.golden_answer: Add the command `cd sdg-translations` after the `git clone` step.

errors.error_description: The command `venv/bin/activate` is used to activate the virtual environment, but it must be sourced (e.g., with `source venv/bin/activate`) to modify the current shell's state.
correction_candidates: Use `source venv/bin/activate` to correctly activate the virtual environment.
The command is correct, but requires `sudo` privileges: `sudo venv/bin/activate`.
On Windows, the correct command is `venv\Scripts\activate`.
Add the venv `bin` directory to your system's PATH variable permanently.
errors.golden_answer: Use `source venv/bin/activate` to correctly activate the virtual environment.
